definition: a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)

sentences.english: Native troops armed with a simple bow and a crude stone axe.
sentences.chinese: 雇佣弓箭兵装备猎弓和简陋石斧。

sentences.english: Bows, arrows, and sticks with sharp iron points were their only weapons.
sentences.chinese: 他们的武器只有弓箭和带有铁尖的棍子。

sentences.english: An arrow would be useless without a bow and an archer.
sentences.chinese: 没有弓和弓箭手，一支箭是不会有用的。

sentences.english: The survivors of the bowmen, the warriors of Kedar, will be few.
sentences.chinese: 弓箭手所余剩的，就是基达人的勇士，必然稀少。

sentences.english: The archers drew all at once.
Plain old wooden arrows just not getting the job done?
sentences.chinese: 觉得朴实无华的木制弓箭难当大任么？

sentences.english: Italy intend to use the slings and arrows as motivational therapy.
sentences.chinese: 意大利打算用吊索和弓箭作为激励疗法。

sentences.english: The earth was saved when a strong archer, Hou Yi, succeeded in shooting down 9 of the suns.
sentences.chinese: 弓箭手后翌射下了9个太阳，拯救了地球上的生灵。

sentences.english: A medieval missile launcher designed on the principle of the crossbow .
sentences.chinese: 一种从石弓中分化出来的用手来发射的弓箭。

sentences.english: And I think that is part of perhaps where bow hunting comes in.
sentences.chinese: 我想这可能正是弓箭狩猎兴起的原因部分原因所在吧。

sentences.english: In every tower stands an archer with a bow in his hand.
sentences.chinese: 每座塔上均杵着一名手握弓箭的射手。

sentences.english: We would not recognize the do-gooding, thigh-slapping, quick-trading gentleman-archer we know from fiction.
sentences.chinese: 小说中我们不会看到那个行善的弓箭手。

sentences.english: God was with the boy as he grew up. He lived in the desert and became an archer.
sentences.chinese: 上帝保佑童子，他就渐长，住在旷野，成了弓箭手。

sentences.english: Archers can be as nervous in battle as arquebusiers.
sentences.chinese: 弓箭手在战斗中一样会紧张。

sentences.english: Improving Marksmanship increases basic bow damage, and increases damage dealt by bow skills.
sentences.chinese: 强化射术提高弓箭伤害及弓技能的伤害。

sentences.english: The archers drew their bows all at once.

definition: firearms (in historical context)/flintlock (old powder and shot firearm)
a bow (weapon)/CL:張|张[zhang1]/to bend/to arch (one's back etc)
